intro: Trachoma binchinae, commonly known as the golden bell tree, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Styracaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant is known for its ornamental value, with its attractive foliage and vibrant floral display. It typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in well-drained soil and full sunlight. The bark and leaves of Trachoma binchinae have been used in traditional medicine for their potential therapeutic properties.
